communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: Anita Perry - DOE 'Asset'
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

I request all records related to or mentioning Anita Perry's participation in Department of Energy delegations and foreign trips. Records should include, but are not limited to, written and electronic correspondence regarding her participation, records related to the cost of her travel, her qualifications, and her official duties and schedule as a member of these delegations. I also request all memoranda and records related from the Office of General Counsel's review of Anita Perry's participation in department delegations. 

The Department of Energy press office confirmed Anita Perry's participation as a delegate in at least two foreign trips in this E&E News report:
https://www.eenews.net/stories/1060065063
The story also contains DOE's confirmation of the Office of General Counsel's review of Anita Perry's participation in department delegations.

As a member of the news media, I request a waiver of fees for this request. I am a reporter whose work has been published with McClatchy Newspapers, The Investigative Fund and Al Jazeera English. I am currently pursuing journalistic projects in the employ of outlets including The Investigative Fund, Climate Home and MuckRock. I am requesting this information for the purposes of newsgathering for MuckRock.com.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Frank Matt

communications.subject: DOE FOIA HQ-2018-00233-F Acknowledgement
communications.communication:
Mr. Matt,

Attached is acknowledgment of your recent FOIA request.

Thank you,
Mayank

Mayank Bishnoi, Esq.
Central Research, Contractor to the
US Department of Energy
1000 Independence Ave, SW
Washington, DC 20585
(202) 287-6686

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #HQ-2018-00233-F
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information request, copied below, and originally submitted on Nov. 7, 2017. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response, or if further clarification is needed.  You had assigned it reference number #HQ-2018-00233-F.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

We are working diligently to process your request and I hope to have a response to you in the next few weeks. Please let me know if you have any questions.
Best Wishes,
Melissa Darr, Esq.
FOIA Analyst
Central Research, Inc. Contractor
U.S. Department of Energy
1000 Independence Avenue, SW
Washington, D.C. 20585

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Matt,

     I am a FOIA Analyst working with the Department of Energy.  I was recently assigned to take over the processing of your above-referenced request.  I couldn't help but notice that some time has passed since you filed your request.  If you are still interested in receiving results to your request, I will do my best to obtain them for you, as quickly as possible.  If you are no longer interested, I can close your request.  Please, let me know, if you are still seeking a response to FOIA request #:  HQ-2018-00233-F.
Best Regards,


Craig E. Greenberg, Esq.
F.O.I.A. Analyst
Central Research, Inc., Contractor
U.S. Department of Energy
1000 Independence Avenue, SW
Washington, DC 20585
Office: (202)586-7504

If we do not hear from you in two (2) weeks, by Wednesday, August 21, 2019, we will assume that you are no longer interested and close
this request on our end.
Best Regards,

Craig E. Greenberg, Esq.
F.O.I.A. Analyst
Central Research, Inc., Contractor
U.S. Department of Energy
1000 Independence Avenue, SW
Washington, DC 20585
Office: (202)586-7504

Frank Matt

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Agency Roster (East Lyme Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Stolen/Lost Firearms ATF California
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I request records of the lost and stolen firearms reported to the ATF from FFTL holders as required by 27 CFR § 478.39a 

The records I request are: 
emails to stolenfirearms@atf.gov
ATF Form 3310.11

Databases or other recording records of the number of stolen/lost firearms and found firearms, including where they were found and whether the guns were used in a crime or attempted to be sold. 

Please limit the search to California
Please limit the search to 2018 to YTD 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Penetrate
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to or generated during the course of the investigation code named "Penetrate",  which detail the Bureau's investigation of a Cuban intelligence agent operating in Puerto Rico, covering the years 1962 through 1965. This investigation is known to have used mail covers. The following file numbers are associated with Penetrate: 65-HQ-67842, 65-SJ-398, 65-MM-2940. The HQ file number is also cited in previously released records on MIRA, which potentially identify Penetrate as Filiberto Inocencio Ojeda-Rios, the subject of a 1970 fugitive case (https://archive.org/details/MovimentoIndependentistaRevolucionarioEnArmas/SJ-100-12315_4_04_70/page/n75/mode/2up).

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

To Whom It May Concern: Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby
request the following records: Records mentioning, relating to or generated
during the course of the investigation code named "Penetrate", which detail
the Bureau's investigation of a Cuban intelligence agent operating in Puerto
Rico, covering the years 1962 through 1965. This investigation is known to
have used mail covers. The following file numbers are associated with
Penetrate: 65-HQ-67842, 65-SJ-398, 65-MM-2940. The HQ file number is also
cited in previously released records on MIRA, which potentially identify
Penetrate as Filiberto Inocencio Ojeda-Rios, the subject of a 1970 fugitive
case
(https://archive.org/details/MovimentoIndependentistaRevolucionarioEnArmas/SJ-100-12315_4_04_70/page/n75/mode/2up).
Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not
limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone
Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and
the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and
cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and
companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite
locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both
investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially
responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I
request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other
documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or
destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has
no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available,
then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional
records are located and processed for release. The requested documents will be
made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for
commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if
you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.
I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if
available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated
cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this
request within 20 business days, as the statute requires. Sincerely, Paul
Galante Upload documents directly:
https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-
bureau-of-
investigation-10%252Fpenetrate-178985%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2JlE9HE18xz1yySUTtxE-3A%3A1tTePP%3AfbDXMgKoe2gqx89jgqdVmLswOnZx_F7ouP_dBbRsiok

**

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Employee Roster - Buffalo, NY
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1.) 2024 or most recent roster of any and all New York State Department of Financial Services employees located at the Buffalo, NY HQ. Please include the first name, last name, date of hire, yearly or hourly pay rate, position, and department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

The Riford Family

Dear Riford, 
The NYS Department of Financial Services received a FOIL request from you on July 30, 2024. You requested: "Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 
1.) 2024 or most recent roster of any and all New York State Department of Financial Services employees located at the Buffalo, NY HQ. Please include the first name, last name, date of hire, yearly or hourly pay rate, position, and department.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires." 
Your request has been referred to the appropriate DFS unit(s) to search for the records that are responsive to your request. The assigned unit(s) will contact you within 20 business days to (i) advise whether the unit has any records that are responsive to your request; (ii) grant or deny your request, if the unit has responsive records; or (iii) apprise you of the progress of your request, if the search or review of the records that you requested is still on-going. 
Sincerely, 
Idel Lendoff 
NYS Department of Financial Services 
If you are a New York State resident and would like to register to vote or update your address, you may complete and submit to your County Board of Elections a New York State Voter Registration Form which can be found at http://www.ny.gov/services/register-vote.

communications.subject: New Message :: R000338-073024
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: FOIL Records Request of July 30, 2024, Reference # R000338-073024 
Dear Riford, 
The NYS Department of Financial Services received a FOIL request from you on July 30, 2024. You requested: "Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 
1.) 2024 or most recent roster of any and all New York State Department of Financial Services employees located at the Buffalo, NY HQ. Please include the first name, last name, date of hire, yearly or hourly pay rate, position, and department. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires." 
The New York State Department of Financial Services (DFS) is still in the process of reviewing the records that you requested, and thus requires additional time to respond to your request. 
DFS will endeavor to provide you the determination of your FOIL request by February 06, 2025, or sooner if possible. However, if DFS is unable to complete its review by that time, you will then be provided an update on the progress of your FOIL request. Your continued patience is greatly appreciated. 
Sincerely, 
Idel Lendoff 
Executive Assistant 
NYS Department of Financial Services

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #R000338-073024
communications.communication:
Dear NYS DFS Appeals,

I am appealing the constructive denial of my FOIL request submitted on 07/29/2024. NYS Dept. of Financial Services has had ample time to provide the records and has not and has repeatedly extended the timeframe for which records are to be provided. As such, I am consider this a constructive denial of records as define by the NYS FOIL. Thank you.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Marin Sheriff 23-24 RIPA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Any and all records reflecting data collected and recorded by the Marin County Sheriff's Office in accordance with the California Racial and Identity Profiling Act (RIPA) from January 1 - December 31, 2023 to December 31, 2024. Please provide the raw data in excel or csv format.

2) Any and all reports, records, and analyses created by, for, or at the direction of, the City/Town that pertain to any RIPA data that has been collected by the Police Department from January 1 - December 31, 2023 to December 31, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Frank Shinneman

title: Contracts and vendor materials of artificial intelligence FOIA programs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Contracts and vendor materials of artificial intelligence FOIA programs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All marketing material and contract documents related to the artificial intelligence programs described in the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission's 2024 Chief FOIA Officer report (https://www.cpsc.gov/s3fs-public/Chief-FOIA-Officers-Report-2024-Final-Cleared.pdf?VersionId=.MyqgoxDvi4HKCS6ph7OTOVvEw1pLGK9).

The materials I request include:
- All marketing materials, brochures, sales pitches and/or other literature.
- Any lists of related contracts.
- Any contracts, including any pilot, proof-of-concept, and public-private partnership agreements.
- Any data purchase, licensing, or exchange agreements.
- Any privacy policies or terms of use/service.
- Any vendor distribution lists for related requests for proposals.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

Due to certain procedural steps we are required to take under our statute, there may be delays in providing the records.  Please be assured that every effort is being made to process each request as equitably as possible, and that the records or information that you have requested will be made available to you at the earliest possible date. title: Classification metadata for old records, and classification & declassification guides (U.S. Department Of Agriculture, Office of the Secretary)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Classification metadata for old records, and classification & declassification guides (U.S. Department Of Agriculture, Office of the Secretary)
communications.communication:
Dear U.S. Department Of Agriculture, Office of the Secretary,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records under 5 USC 552(a)(3), as to your Department, including every component or otherwise associated agency, corporation, or other establishment of the executive branch within the meaning of 5 USC 552(f)(1):

1. for each record created before Jan. 1, 2016, that was ever classified in whole or in part, a CSV formatted spreadsheet of the following EO 13526 information:
a. a unique record identifier, and location information, sufficient to enable a FOIA officer to easily and precisely locate that record, and that is as descriptive as is feasible without disclosing classified information
b. the date the record was created
c. the classification level and codewords (e.g. "TS/SCI//FISA", "SECRET//ORCON/NOFORN", "TOP SECRET//COMINT//REL TO USA, FVEY",  or the like)
d. the identity of the original classification authority, including their personal identifier, agency, office, position, and name
e. the agency and office of origin
f. the date of original classification
g. the date or event for declassification per EO 13526 § 1.5(a), or the 10–25 year declassification date per § 1.5(b), as the case may be
h. the concise reason for classification
i. the applicable classifications categories from EO 13526 § 1.4
j. the  associated "classification guide" and/or "declassification guide" within the meaning of EO 13526 § 6.1(h) & (n), or if those are separate full documents rather than relatively short text, their record unique identifiers
k. EO 13526 § 1.6(a)(1)(D) information (in the case of information that should clearly and demonstrably be expected to reveal the identity of a confidential human source or a human intelligence source or key design concepts of weapons of mass destruction, the marking prescribed in implementing directives issued pursuant to EO 13526)
l. EO 13526 § 3.3(b), (c), (d), (g), (h), (i), & (j) information (automatic declassification exemption), including the particular subparagraphs claimed to be applicable, and the applicable details (such as explanations of exemption, date exempted, exempting authority, etc)
m. all other classification metadata, such as "derived from" markers (see e.g. EO 13526 § 2.1), foreign classifications (see e.g. EO 13526 § 1.6(e)), etc.
n. the FOIA identifiers of every request made which covered that record

2. all classification guides within the meaning of EO 13526 §§ 6.1(h), together with their unique record identifiers
3. all declassification guides within the meaning of EO 13526 §§ 6.1(n), together with their unique record identifiers


For item 1, to the extent that you are unable to narrow your search based on the age of the underlying records, please either substitute the text "created before Jan. 1, 2016" with "classified before Jan. 1, 2016" or ignore the text ", created before Jan. 1, 2016" — i.e. you may construe the relevant date as the date of classification rather than the date of record creation (if you don't have the latter but have the former), and you may have false positives (additionally disclosing the classification metadata of records that are from 2016 or later), but you may not have false negatives (failing to disclose exemptions about records that are from before 2016, e.g. because your search fails to include classification metadata about records whose creation date you didn't track).

To the extent that you do not have item 1 records in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide records that would most closely approximate it — i.e. comprising a bulk index of classification information that would be useful for making FOIA requests of records whose classification has expired — such as (in decreasing order of preference) records compiled for the purpose of conducting (or for the then-future conduction of) declassification or declassification review under EO 13526, such as §§ 3.3, 3.4, 3.5, or 3.6 automatic, systematic, or mandatory declassification; classification logs; record indices; record cover sheets; or the like.

This request has no time or subject limit whatsoever, other than that the cutoff date is the date of your search.

For all responsive records, I request:
a. all parts of the record (i.e. no portion of a record with some responsive portion may be considered "non-responsive")
b. all record metadata, such as dates on which they were drafted, passed, went into effect, withdrawn, or similar events; person(s) / office(s) responsible; authors; IDs; revision numbers; email headers; hyperlinks; structural metadata; email addresses; comments; revision history; timestamps; file names and contents; pagination or lack thereof; format specific metadata (e.g. particular to Word, PDF, or paper files); filing location, labeling, & organization; etc.
c. if any classification applies, mandatory declassification review (MDR) under E.O. 13526, and the result of the MDR, including any declassified records.



# Form & format

## Native email format & minimal redaction

Please provide all email records in EML, Maildir, or MBOX format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide all other records in their original electronic format (if electronic), and as one 300dpi color scan PDF per logical document, staple, paperclip, or file folder (whichever is most narrow) if the original is in paper format.

Please note that FOIA requires you to service the maximum extent of my request that can be done via e.g. partial redaction of exempt material. If you believe some portions of a record to be exempt because it contains classified information (18 USC 798), please provide a version of the record redacted to the minimum extent necessary to remove exempt information, along with adequate information to describe the reason for each specific exemption, and without altering any non exempt information (including metadata).

## No new records; electronic & original format

This request does not ask you to create new records.

If you determine that a response would require creating a new record that you do not want to create, please first contact me by email with an explanation of what records you have that would most closely match the information requested and might be acceptable substitutes, so that we can reasonably tailor the request.

In particular, I specifically request that you do not create new documents in response to this request that are modifications of a digital record, such as page-view images, print views, scans, or the like. No such creation or substitution is authorized by FOIA.

However, if the same or similar records are held in both electronic and paper formats, this request includes both the paper and electronic versions. The paper version and the digital version are distinct records, and each may contain distinct information such as handwritten or other markings on the paper copy and embedded metadata in the electronic version. I specifically request both the original, electronic format record, and (if it contains any additional markings) the paper record.

To the extent that the original native electronic format is proprietary or otherwise not in format accessible by widely available, open source software, I also request
1. an export of the proprietary format into a standard, open format, and
2. all proprietary software and documentation necessary to use and understand the original, proprietary format records.

## Rehab Act § 508 compliance

I am partially blind. In accordance with 5 USC 552(a)(3)(B & C) (E-FOIA), Rehabilitation Act § 508, and the FOIA Improvement Act, I require that you respond using original, native format, electronic, machine-processable, accessible, open, and well structured records to the maximum extent possible — for both the content of your response, and any communications about the request (such as response letters).

Please make all correspondence pursuant to this request — including notification and responsive records — by email, with native electronic format records, as specified in the request. I do not authorize you to send anything to me by physical mail unless I specifically state otherwise.

## Compression, passwords, and uploading large files

Multiple files may be sent in a combined, compressed form using standard ZIP, TAR, GZIP, BZIP2, and/or RAR formats, or sent as separate files, at your discretion.

Do not use any password on any files, including ZIP files etc., unless a password was present in the original, native format (in which case, leave it unaltered, and send me the password). Do not respond using ZixCorp "Secure Mail" or any other method that "expires" records from being available. Use only actual email and direct attachments, or upload using the link below, unless I explicitly request otherwise.

If there are any files you prefer not to transfer by email (e.g. if they are >10MB), please upload them to me via the link listed below my signature. Doing so is secure, completely free to you, and I will be notified of the upload. If that is insufficient, I can also provide Google Drive, Dropbox, SFTP, rsync, or similar provisions that will let you easily upload hundreds of gigabytes of data to me for free.

## Redaction of repeatedly occurring content

When redacting any content that appears more than once in the full set of responsive records, please assign a replacement identifier for each, so that your redaction does not obfuscate the commonality.

For example, suppose that responsive records include the names Alice, Bob, and Chris, and you determine that each of those names are redactable (e.g. under (b)(7) or (b)(6)). Rather than redacting each with only the text "(b)(7)(C)", replace each instance of "Alice" with "(b)(7)(D) - confidential source 1", each instance of "Bob" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 2", each instance of "Chris" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 3",  etc. This would vindicate your narrow interest in withholding the person's identity, while not withholding the facts of commonality between occurrences, nor the relevant natures of each redacted person, which you would not have justification to withhold.

Please use reasonably descriptive identifiers. For instance, if Alice's name is not redacted but her personal cellphone number is, and that cellphone number appears e.g. both in her email signature and elsewhere by itself, it should in both cases be redacted with the same descriptive identifier, such as "Alice's cell #" (or "confidential source 1's cell #" if her name is redacted, as above). 

Please use a unique replacement identifier number for each distinct item — e.g. even if you only redact two entities, and they have different descriptors such that the descriptors would distinguish them, use "confidential source 1" and "US congressional aide 2", not "US congressional aide 1". The result should be that there is exactly one replacement identifier number per identical redacted content, across all records produced, with no reuse of the same number for different content, nor use of different numbers for the same content — except for the purposes of descriptive reference, e.g. the "2" in "confidential source 1 email to US congressional aide 2".

If a classification codeword is itself classified — meaning very specifically the text of that codeword, e.g. if the literal texts "STLW" and/or "STELLARWIND" were themselves classified, not merely their expansions, referents, or covered records —  please use a replacement like "TSC 4" or "SC 5" (as applicable). Likewise, if the existence of a particular classification authority office is classified, please use a replacement like "NSA office 6". Etc.

For PDFs, replacement identifiers can be specified in the margins if they don't fit in the original space. For more native electronic files, like EML, this can be done by direct editing. If space or file format does not permit you to do so inline or in margins or equivalent, then please use just the replacement identifier number (e.g. "[#52]"), and provide a CSV formatted table matching replacement identifier numbers to full replacement identifiers with your response letter.

If you make any such redactions, please keep but do not provide a table matching codes/identifiers to the redacted content, for use in case your redaction is examined or overturned on appeal or in litigation.

This is a form and format request pertaining to your process of redaction. Because it only applies in situations when you have already exercised the voluntary decision to alter the records from the original form requested, you have necessarily waived any objection to this section "creating a new record", since your act of redaction itself already "makes a new record" in that limited sense. This is only about how you do a redaction you have already decided to make.

This provision limits the scope of your redaction to the minimum possible extent, and specifies the form and format of your redactions, so that even if you decide to withhold some particular piece of content, you do not also withhold the fact of its being the same as the same content appearing elsewhere, or the kind of thing redacted. That fact is itself metadata that is explicitly requested as part of this request. If you decide that the mere fact of two pieces of content being the same is itself withholdable, then please redact it using a replacement identifier that encodes only the reason.


# Rolling updates

Please provide me with rolling (incremental) updates, rather than having the entirety of the request be blocked until fully completed.

Please preserve all responsive records that you currently hold, pending release, particularly ones that are currently held in electronic form or format.

Please prioritize rolling updates based on what is most readily available, i.e. such that you release as the greatest amount of records in the fastest time.


# Fee waiver

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial, journalistic purposes;
* EO 13526 requires you to already be automatically and systematically compiling and acting on the records in item 1, and to centrally store the records in items 1 & 2;
* I am requesting records to be provided exclusively in electronic format, with no paper copies, so you should incur no actual costs; and
* the President determined in EO 13526 that 10–25 year old classified records should be declassified, and the records requested would serve as an index for a follow-up request for all such records, to make them widely available.


# Request tracking numbers and estimated completion date

Upon receipt, and in every followup response, please state your tracking number(s) for this request, as well as your specific estimated completion date. 5 USC 552(a)(7).


Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your initial response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.
Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt corporation devoted to public interest journalism, government transparency and accountability, individuals' civil rights, and related issues.

P.S. My full legal name is just Sai. Please use no title for me.

communications.subject: USDA FOIA 2025-DA-01536-F Acknowledgement
communications.communication:
Dear Sai:

This email acknowledges receipt of your attached Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s (USDA), Office of Information Affairs, FOIA Division (OIA-FOIA). Your request was received by this office on November 4, 2024.

The OIA-FOIA is under the purview of the General Counsel (GC) and serves as the focal point for USDA’s FOIA program. It provides coordination and ensures agency-wide compliance with the FOIA.  Additionally, the OIA-FOIA processes requests and appeals on behalf of the Office of the Secretary (OSEC); the Under Secretaries; USDA’s staff offices; and the Research, Education and Economics and Trade and Foreign Agricultural Affairs mission areas.

The FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i), requires USDA to make a determination in response to a FOIA request within 20 business days from its date of receipt. In unusual circumstances, the Federal agency time limit may be extended by 10 business days as stated in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If your request seeks numerous records that will necessitate a wide-ranging search, including searches with components and possible consultations with components that have a substantial interest in the determination of this request, USDA will invoke a 10 business day extension for determination of your request. You have the option to narrow the scope of your request to limit the number of potentially responsive records.

Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Pursuant to USDA FOIA Regulations, Title 7 CFR §1.6(a), the USDA processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt.

Provisions of the FOIA allow USDA to recover part of the cost of complying with your request. For purposes of fee assessment, you were categorized as a “all other” requester, pursuant to 7 CFR Appendix A to Subpart A of Part 1, Section (2)(b)(5)(i). For your review and information, a copy of the USDA FOIA Fee Schedule is attached. In accordance with 7 CFR Appendix A to Subpart A of Part 1, Section 3(b), your fees shall be waived where the amount of the fee is $25.00 or less.

You have requested a fee waiver.  Your fee waiver request is under consideration.

A search will be conducted for records responsive to your request. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that a FOIA analyst will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request.

Your request has been assigned FOIA Case No. 2025-DA-01536-F. Please refer to this case number in any future correspondence. If you have any questions regarding the processing of this request, please contact Gina Lee at (202) 692-5228 or electronically at Gina.Lee@usda.gov<mailto:Gina.Lee@usda.gov> or USDAFOIA@usda.gov<mailto:USDAFOIA@usda.gov>. For additional information regarding USDA FOIA regulations and process, please refer to the information available on-line at Freedom of Information Act Division | USDA.<https://www.usda.gov/ogc/office-information-affairs/foia-division>

We appreciate the opportunity to assist you.

Sincerely,

Office of Information Affairs

Freedom of Information Act Division

Best Regards,

[cid:image001.png@01DB3119.43C2B9A0]
Gina Lee
FOIA Analyst Contractor
Office of Information Affairs
FOIA Division
U.S. Department of Agriculture
1400 Independence Ave., SW
Washington, DC  20250
☎  (202) 692-5228
✉   Gina.Lee@usda.gov<mailto:Gina.Lee@usda.gov>






This electronic message contains information generated by the USDA solely for the intended recipients. Any unauthorized interception of this message or the use or disclosure of the information it contains may violate the law and subject the violator to civil or criminal penalties. If you believe you have received this message in error, please notify the sender and delete the email immediately.

title: Agency Roster (Port Saint Lucie Police Department)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Agency Roster (Port Saint Lucie Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

November 4, 2024

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Sceintology trafficking files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I am formally requesting the following records:

- All releasable documents that reference "Scientology" within any closed Human Trafficking investigation files, dated from 2008 onward.

I am an independent researcher exploring the multiple investigations into Scientology. This request is made solely to raise public awareness and for educational purposes. I believe this issue holds considerable public interest, particularly in light of a December 2012 article, which stated the U.S. Department of Homeland Security had been investigating allegations of human trafficking within the Church of Scientology. The investigation may have been conducted by the Tampa field office, with lead investigator Justin Deutsch.

Here is the article referencing the investigation.

https://tonyortega.org/2012/12/13/homeland-security-investigating-scientology-for-human-trafficking/

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cassie Sipe

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2024-ICFO-55733
communications.communication:
09/10/2024 

Cassie Sipe 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2024-ICFO-55733 
 
Dear Requester: 

This acknowledges receipt of your 8/22/2024, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for all releasable documents that reference Scientology within any closed Human Trafficking files, dated from 2008 onward.  Your request was received in this office on 8/23/2024. 

Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Per Section 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, ICE processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although ICE’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, the FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period. As your request seeks numerous documents that will necessitate a thorough and wide-ranging search, ICE will invoke a 10-day extension for your request, as allowed by Title 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If you’re able to narrow the scope of your request please contact our office. Narrowing the scope may speed up the search process. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner. 

Provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS Interim FOIA regulations, as they apply to media requesters.  As a media requester, you will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication; the first 100 pages are free.  We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. You will be contacted before any further fees are accrued. 

We have queried the appropriate program offices within ICE for responsive records. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 

If you have any questions, please contact FOIA Public Liaison, Daniel Edgington at 500 12th Street, SW, Washington DC 20536 or (866) 633-1182. Additionally, you have a right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Your request has been assigned reference number 2024-ICFO-55733. Please use this number in future correspondence. 

Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009

title: All Audio From E911 Call Center Dispatch For Dates December 5th to December 7th of 2022

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: All Audio From E911 Call Center Dispatch For Dates December 5th to December 7th of 2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking your assistance in obtaining E911 Audio (Audio of callers, dispatch,  et. el.) for calls placed to the Sunnyvale DPS Dispatch center. I am able to receive these files via USB, CD, DVD, or other digital formats, if available. I am requesting, specifically, audio from the dates of December 5th, 6th, and 7th. in the year 2022. As law requires, the retention of E911 audio should be available for no less than one year, this request will hopefully be fairly easy to fulfill.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

HTP

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: All Audio From E911 Call Center Dispatch For Dates December 5th to December 7th of 2022
communications.communication:
Dear HTP,

There were 349 calls made to the agency on December 5-7, 2022.  This will take significant time to go through the calls to determine which calls can be released to you.  Our agency does not release any 911 calls related to criminal cases (reference to Gov. Code, §§ 7923.600-7923.625 (formerly Gov. Code, § 6254(f)); Haynie v. Superior Court (2001) 26 Cal.4th 1061).  Can you narrow down your request?

Thanks,
Phuong

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: All Audio From E911 Call Center Dispatch For Dates December 5th to December 7th of 2022
communications.communication:
Greetings,

My apologies for the lengthy time in responding, but I've been dealing with health issues. 

Thank you for the detailed response. Being that this request could be a little more large than I realized, I can scope the request down to the following:

DECEMBER 5: 8PM Pacific to 1:00AM Pacific (Following Day) OR UTC: December 6, 2024 at 04:00:00 - 10:00:00
DECEMBER 6: 8PM Pacific to 1:00AM Pacific (Following Day) OR UTC: December 7, 2024 at 04:00:00 - 10:00:00
DECEMBER 7: 8PM Pacific to 1:00AM Pacific (Following Day) OR UTC: December 8, 2024 at 04:00:00 - 10:00:00

Would you be able to accommodate this request for any calls that are able to be released for this timeframe instead?

Sincerely,
HTP

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: All Audio From E911 Call Center Dispatch For Dates December 5th to December 7th of 2022
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for your email.  I will do some research and get back to you on or before the 10th day.

Thank you,

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: All Audio From E911 Call Center Dispatch For Dates December 5th to December 7th of 2022
communications.communication:
Hello,
I would like clarity on the timeframe you’re requesting.  I just want to make sure I got this correctly.

12/5/2022 – 8pm to 1am
12/6/2022 – 4am to 10am and 8pm to 1am
12/7/2022 - 4am to 10am and 8pm to 1am
12/8/2022 – 4am to 10am

Thank you,

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: All Audio From E911 Call Center Dispatch For Dates December 5th to December 7th of 2022
communications.communication:
Also, my dispatcher has a few questions for you:

  *   Would it be every single call that came into the dispatch center?
  *   911 calls only or non-emergency calls?
  *   Calls from Field Units to Dispatch?
  *   Are you also requesting Radio Traffic in addition to phone calls?
Thank you,
Phuong

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: All Audio From E911 Call Center Dispatch For Dates December 5th to December 7th of 2022
communications.communication:
Greetings!

Answers Inline:

* Would it be every single call that came into the dispatch center?
Yes

* 911 calls only or non-emergency calls?
Calls in which "911" was dialed, or if it's referred to as E911, or PSAP, any of those should help narrow the focus a bit. Emergency only. 

* Calls from Field Units to Dispatch?
If available as well; Yes

* Are you also requesting Radio Traffic in addition to phone calls?
That would be great!


Thank you for the help through this process.

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: All Audio From E911 Call Center Dispatch For Dates December 5th to December 7th of 2022
communications.communication:
With regards to the dates, I thought adding "UTC" would have helped as it is typically a standardized time. However, this appears to be causing confusion, so I will restate that the dates and times of interest are:

DECEMBER 5: 8PM Pacific to 1:00AM Pacific (Rolling in to following Day)
DECEMBER 6: 8PM Pacific to 1:00AM Pacific (Rolling in to following Day)
DECEMBER 7: 8PM Pacific to 1:00AM Pacific (Rolling in to following Day)

Thank you!

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: All Audio From E911 Call Center Dispatch For Dates December 5th to December 7th of 2022
communications.communication:
Thank you for getting back to me with the clarifications as well as the date/time range. We are currently working on your request.

Are you also looking for fire-related 911 calls?
Regards,
Phuong

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: All Audio From E911 Call Center Dispatch For Dates December 5th to December 7th of 2022
communications.communication:
Hello,

My apologies this request is taking so long.  Attached are incidents related to your request.  Please note personal identifying information (PII) was redacted from the records.  I will work on the audio files next.  This will be released as they become available, as the PII needs to be redacted from the audio files as well.

Thank you for your patience.

Regards,
Phuong

communications.communication:
Greetings,

Thanks for your response. Indeed you've included every 911 call requested and I am grateful for the amount of time you spent on this. The files I'm mentioning are:
From November Emails:
SV223390163_911_Call.wav
SV223390165_911_Call.wav
[...]
SV223410234_911_Call.wav

Whereas the second batch of calls and radio traffic you provided (December emails) came with both 911 calls as well as the radio traffic, the above batch of calls did not. For example:
(Redaction)_SV223390177_911_Call.wav.m4a
(Redaction)_SV223390177_Radio_Traffic.wav.m4a
(Redaction)_SV223390185_911_Call.wav.m4a
(Redaction)_SV223390185_Radio_Traffic.wav.m4a

The Radio Traffic portion seems to be missing. Did it hopefully get processed and saved somewhere accessible, but possibly just not attached? If the files can be found, please attach them when you can.

If the files are no longer available, I'm not going to request that you re-work this request, rest assured. However, I am hopeful that the other data may be available and that this might just have an easy resolution!

I hope this email finds you well,
Take care.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Select Secure Scheduling Council Emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all emails and attachments identified in the attached file ("2024-08-01_C169558_Fugiel-LEG_Seattle-Council-select-metadata.csv"). Note that this file contains a subset of metadata for 986 emails (of which 232 have attachments) selected from a much larger set of emails sent or received by Council Members or staff with reference to the Secure Scheduling Ordinance. I obtained these metadata in response to a preliminary request (#C169558-020124) which I used to identify the most relevant records for my research. I modified the original metadata file ("20240320_C169558_Fugiel_metadata_LEG.csv") by adding an index for the row number, removing empty or uninformative columns, classifying the period when the email was sent (Y1 = 2016, Y2 = 2017), and flagging selected emails (Selected = TRUE). I believe that the modified file contains sufficient information to retrieve the selected emails and attachments. Please let me know if you encounter any difficulty using this file or would prefer for me to merge the selection flag into the full metadata file.

I am requesting these records for non-commercial research purposes. The records will be made available to the general public. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

files.title: 2024-08-01_C169558_Fugiel-LEG_Seattle-Council-select-metadata.csv
files.source: Peter Fugiel

communications.subject: Legislative Branch :: C191956-080124
communications.communication:
Dear Peter Fugiel, 
 
Welcome to the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center (PRRC). Your request was received on August 01, 2024 and is appended below. 
 
The reference number for this request is C191956-080124. You will see this number in the title of any communications about this request. 
 
You will hear from a Public Disclosure Officer within five business days regarding the status of your request. 
 
Please visit the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center where you can manage your profile and access your request. Your login ID is: 170805-47797053@requests.muckrock.com (
 
If a Public Disclosure Officer submitted your public disclosure request into the PRRC on your behalf, please login and complete your new user account by following these steps: 
 
  * Access the Public Records Request Center 
  * Select 'Forgot my Password' 
  * Enter your 'Login ID' (email address) 
  * A temporary password will be sent to you via email 
  * Login with the temporary password 
You may now visit the PRRC 'My Records Request Center' anytime! 
 
Request C191956-080124:  
" To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all emails and attachments identified in the attached file ("2024-08-01_C169558_Fugiel-LEG_Seattle-Council-select-metadata.csv"). Note that this file contains a subset of metadata for 986 emails (of which 232 have attachments) selected from a much larger set of emails sent or received by Council Members or staff with reference to the Secure Scheduling Ordinance. I obtained these metadata in response to a preliminary request (#C169558-020124) which I used to identify the most relevant records for my research. I modified the original metadata file ("20240320_C169558_Fugiel_metadata_LEG.csv") by adding an index for the row number, removing empty or uninformative columns, classifying the period when the email was sent (Y1 = 2016, Y2 = 2017), and flagging selected emails (Selected = TRUE). I believe that the modified file contains sufficient information to retrieve the selected emails and attachments. Please let me know if you encounter any difficulty using this file or would prefer for me to merge the selection flag into the full metadata file.

I am requesting these records for non-commercial research purposes. The records will be made available to the general public. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

Attachments:

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/peter.fugiel/140788/2024-08-01_C169558_Fugiel-LEG_Seattle-Council-select-metadata.csv

communications.subject: Legislative Branch :: C191956-080124
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Dear Peter Fugiel, 
This acknowledges receipt of your public disclosure request C191956-080124 received on August 01, 2024 regarding: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

A copy of all emails and attachments identified in the attached file ("2024-08-01_C169558_Fugiel-LEG_Seattle-Council-select-metadata.csv"). Note that this file contains a subset of metadata for 986 emails (of which 232 have attachments) selected from a much larger set of emails sent or received by Council Members or staff with reference to the Secure Scheduling Ordinance. I obtained these metadata in response to a preliminary request (#C169558-020124) which I used to identify the most relevant records for my research. I modified the original metadata file ("20240320_C169558_Fugiel_metadata_LEG.csv") by adding an index for the row number, removing empty or uninformative columns, classifying the period when the email was sent (Y1 = 2016, Y2 = 2017), and flagging selected emails (Selected = TRUE). I believe that the modified file contains sufficient information to retrieve the selected emails and attachments. Please let me know if you encounter any difficulty using this file or would prefer for me to merge the selection flag into the full metadata file. 

I am requesting these records for non-commercial research purposes. The records will be made available to the general public. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Peter Fugiel 
Postdoctoral Research Fellow 
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations 

Attachments: 

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/peter.fugiel/140788/2024-08-01_C169558_Fugiel-LEG_Seattle-Council-select-metadata.csv 
Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcity-council-219%252Fselect-secure-scheduling-council-emails-170805%252F%253Femail%253Dmuckrockseattle%252540mycusthelp.net&url_auth_token=AAAbJQToMIQHI1KMRcuzZrve4-c%3A1sZjGp%3AGHU1GXum0pus9tCKOc9CIy8O4-AZfCBLGClic8gMa1s 
Pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, this is notification that the City of Seattle has received your public disclosure request. At this time, we anticipate that we will be able to provide the requested records or a first installment of records on or about November 15, 2024. 
I am going to figure out how to run a search that will pull those records. The trick is to figure out how to create a formula to translate the data in the Excel into a Boolean search that targets only those 986 records. You have given me a challenge that will actually likely be very helpful for other requesters. I look forward to working on it. 
Sincerely, 
Matt Jaeger 
(206) 684-8159 
Legislative Department

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C191956-080124
communications.communication:
Dear Peter Fugiel, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C191956-080124 received on August 01, 2024 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV24-C191956-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C191956-080124. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-C191956-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI Use-of-Force Database - Canine
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All use-of-force incident reports in the FBI's National Use of Force Data Collection database where the one of the values for the data element "force_type_ids" is "Canine".

For assistance in locating these records, the Use-of-Force Incident Report JSON layout include the data element "force_type_ids" and "Canine" as one data value for that element, according to to technical specifications on the National Use-of-Force Data Collection Program (https://www.fbi.gov/file-repository/ucr/use-of-force-flat-file-bulk-load-tech-spec.pdf/view). I am specifically requesting all incident reports where the data values of "force_type_ids" includes "Canine".

I would prefer these incident reports in json or another machine-readable format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1552556-000
communications.communication:
Hi,
I'm writing in regards to FOIA request 1552556-000, and wondering if I could get an update or estimated date of completion, as it has been about a year and a half since I filed it. Any information appreciated. Thanks,

CJ Ciaramella

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1552556-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for your inquiry regarding the status of your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy (FOIPA) request.   A review of your request has determined the following:

The request is presently awaiting assignment to a Disclosure analyst who will then review the records to determine if any redactions are required pursuant to subsections of Title 5, U. S. Code, Section 552 and 552a.

You may check the status of your request online at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request’ link.  Online status reports are updated weekly.

Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 122 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 1,230 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,010 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,370 days for processing.

Your request is currently in the complex request medium processing track, and the estimated date of completion for your request is November 2025.  If your request is considered a complex track, considering reducing the scope of your request may accelerate the process as it could potentially place your request in a quicker processing track.  This may also reduce any search and duplication costs, if applicable, and allow for a more timely receipt of your information.  If you wish to discuss reducing the scope of your request, please indicate so and a representative will be in contact.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.communication:

All of (Sugoria Russell) arrest, dashcam & bodycam footage. 

Name: Sugoria I Russell
DOB: 05/24/1990
Address: 4628 n Central Park Ave 
Chicago, IL 60625

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sugoria Russell

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Ex CPS Principals, Personnel Files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

* Abdul Muhammad, current Assistant Principal at Bogan High School
* Jessica Biggs, ex-CPS employee, incoming CPS Board member
* Femi Skanes, ex-CPS Principal

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements/agreements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

This request is on behalf of The FOIA Bakery, an Illinois nonprofit. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=16590
