Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements. 

This request is on behalf of The FOIA Bakery, an Illinois nonprofit. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fex-cps-principals-personnel-files-177423%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1tLYOv%3AFFuMpK_LACDlcALt1KL_Jd9L4v0U44IOaiPkj57s1Yc 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information (personal descriptions, employee ID numbers, college transcripts, social security numbers, citizenship status, signatures, personal addresses, medical information, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) exempts “ information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State Law … ” (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) Specifically, 105 ILCS 5/10-21.9 (b) states that “ any information concerning the record of convictions obtained by the president of the school board or the regional superintendent shall be confidential and may only be transmitted to the superintendent of the school district or his designee, the appropriate regional superintendent if the check was requested by the school district, the presidents of the appropriate school boards if the check was requested from the Department of State Police by the regional superintendent, the State Superintendent of Education, the State Teacher Certification Board, any other person necessary to the decision of hiring the applicant for employment, or for clarification purposes the Department of State Police or Statewide Sex Offender Database, or both.” Portions of this request that include personnel evaluations are redacted entirely in accordance with section 7(1)(a) of FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) which exempts from public release information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law and also in accordance with section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)) which exempts from public release information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.] Student information has been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r) which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA generally prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at is direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored.” (105 ILCS 10/2(d). The identities of complainants have been redacted pursuant to section 7(d)(iv) of the FOIA which exempts confidential information furnished only by the confidential source, or persons who file complaints with or provide information to administrative, investigative, law enforcement, or penal agencies. Section 7.5(h) exempts from disclosure “information the disclosure of which is exempted under the State Officials and Employees Ethics Act, and records of any lawfully created State or local inspector general’s office that would be exempt if created or obtained by an Executive Inspector General’s office.” 5 ILCS 140/7.5(h). Records of discipline more than four years old are exempt from disclosure pursuant to section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)), which exempts information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.]. 820 ILCS 40/8 of the Personnel Records Review Act states that “an employer shall review a personnel record before releasing information to a third party and, except when the release is ordered to a party in a legal action or arbitration, delete disciplinary reports, letters of reprimand, or other records of disciplinary action which are more than 4 years old. Certain records are being withheld entirely pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(f) at this time as factual information inextricably intertwined in ongoing investigation and processes as well as 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(n), which exempts from release records relating to the adjudication of employee discipline and grievance matters except for records reflecting the final outcome. 
You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: Performance Guarantees for Subdivision Construction in Acton

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Performance Guarantees for Subdivision Construction in Acton
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

For each of the Subdivisions listed below, please provide:

(1)	A copy of the subdivision surety provided under G.L. c.41 §81U (performance guarantee, e.g. bond, restrictive covenant, etc.) and any amendments thereof;
(2)	Every written request to extend the completion date specified within the subdivision surety;
(3)	Every written request for partial release of the subdivision surety, and records of the granting of any such requests;
(4)	Every written request for final release of the subdivision surety, with all accompanying documentation, and records of receipt of such requests by (i) the Acton Planning Board and (ii) the Acton Town Clerk;
(5)	Any written certification by the Town of Acton that the principal has completed all obligations specified in the surety;
(6)	A record authorizing the final release of the subdivision security.


List of Subdivisions:

PB 13-05, “The Residences at Constitution Drive”
PB 14-03, “Roosevelt Drive”
PB 14-04, “Hayward Farm”
PB 15-07, “Jaime’s Way & Thomas Drive”
PB 16-10, “Mohegan Lane”
PB 16-15, “Summer Place”
PB 16-19, “Kellev’s Corner Southeast Lots”
PB 17-08, “Laurentide Circle”
PB 18-03, “180 Newtown Road PCRC”
PB 18-05, “110 Nagog Hill Road”
PB 19-04 “96 Newtown Road/Dylan Place”
PB 19-06, “Pond View Way”
PB 19-10, “Diplatzi Place”
PB 20-02, “The Preserve at Audubon Hill”
PB 21-02, “Amanda Lane”
PB 21-03, “Grassy Pond Way”
PB 21-07, “Hawk’s Crest Reserve”
PB 22-07, “Timber Way”

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

communications.subject: Your Town of Acton, MA public records request #24-260 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
Town of Acton, MA ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-260 has been submitted successfully. Hello, The Town Clerk’s office is in receipt of your request and will provide you a reply as soon as possible, but in any event within the ten (10) business days required by statute.   This request will be forwarded to the appropriate Departments. If the responding Department(s) believe that the search and collection of requested documents will take more than two hours, that Department will provide you with an estimate of costs for the retrieval of the requested Public Records. That estimated fee will be based on a fee of $25.00 per hour for each hour (or part thereof) over two hours. We will require payment of the estimated fee prior to gathering the requested information. If a thumb/flash drive is needed due to the large amount of data, we will assess an additional $5.00 fee for that hardware.     You will be contacted if there are any questions or we need further information. Once the information has been gathered, it will be forwarded to you.   “The records access officer shall provide a written response under M.G.L. c. 66, § 10(b) to a request for public records no later than the tenth business day following the receipt of a request notwithstanding the applicability of any petition filed pursuant to 950 CMR 32.06(4)”.    Please contact this office if you have any questions.   Thank you. Acton Town Clerk As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the Town of Acton, MA portal. If you haven't already signed in, you may need to activate or setup your account to get started. Once your account is activated, you can communicate directly with the Town of Acton, MA through NextRequest. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Town of Acton, MA.

A records custodian may charge a reasonable fee to recover the costs of complying with a public records request. In addition to the search and segregation fees, records custodians may charge $0.05 for either single and double-sided black and white paper copies or printouts. When the request is for materials that are not susceptible to ordinary means of reproduction, such as photographs or computer tapes, the actual cost of reproduction may be assessed to the requestor. Municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? title: Suicide in the Military (Office Of Secretary Of Defense And Joint Chief Of Staff (OSD/JS))

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Suicide in the Military (Office Of Secretary Of Defense And Joint Chief Of Staff (OSD/JS))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am seeking additional information about suicide in the military beyond what is presented in the attached 2022 Annual Report on Suicide in the Military.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the years 2015-2023:
1) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by state;
2) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by state and means;
3) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by state and means and precise location (private residence, barracks, etc);
4) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by facility;
5) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by facility and means;
6) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by facility and means and precise location (private residence, barracks, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Burd-Sharps
Kathryn Fingar
Mackey O'Keefe
Paige Tetens

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2025-00065-F
communications.communication:
Dear Sarah Burd-Sharps,

Thank you for your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA)/Privacy Act (PA) inquiry from the DHA FOIA Requester Service Center. Your request has been forwarded to the analyst handling this case, they will contact you within 24 to 48 hours to brief you on your records status request. title: Use of herbicides in the Luquillo (El Yunque) Forest Reserve (U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Use of herbicides in the Luquillo (El Yunque) Forest Reserve (U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records from the U.S. Agricultural Research Station at Mayagüez relating to, mentioning, or describing the use of herbicides and military herbicides, including but not limited to arboricide Picloram in the Luquillo (El Yunque) Forest Reserve between the years of 1961 and 1967. Please also include cross-reference documents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristofer Ríos

communications.subject: USDA FOIA Request No. 2024-REE-05419-F Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
Dear Kristopher Rios:

This email acknowledges receipt of your attached Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s (USDA), Office of Information Affairs, FOIA Division (OIA-FOIA). Your request was received by this office on June 14, 2024. The request was originally submitted to the Department of Veteran Affairs, who then routed the request to the OIA.

The OIA-FOIA is under the purview of the General Counsel (GC) and serves as the focal point for USDA’s FOIA program. It provides coordination and ensures agency-wide compliance with the FOIA.  Additionally, the OIA-FOIA processes requests and appeals on behalf of the Office of the Secretary (OSEC); the Under Secretaries; USDA’s staff offices; and the Research, Education and Economics and Trade and Foreign Agricultural Affairs mission areas.

The FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i), requires USDA to make a determination in response to a FOIA request within 20 business days from its date of receipt. In unusual circumstances, the Federal agency time limit may be extended by 10 business days as stated in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If your request seeks numerous records that will necessitate a wide-ranging search, including searches with components and possible consultations with components that have a substantial interest in the determination of this request, USDA will invoke a 10 business day extension for determination of your request. You have the option to narrow the scope of your request to limit the number of potentially responsive records.

Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Pursuant to USDA FOIA Regulations, Title 7 CFR §1.6(a), the USDA processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt.

Provisions of the FOIA allow USDA to recover part of the cost of complying with your request. For purposes of fee assessment, you were categorized as a “all other” requester, pursuant to 7 CFR Appendix A to Subpart A of Part 1, Section (2)(b)(5)(i). For your review and information, a copy of the USDA FOIA Fee Schedule is attached. In accordance with 7 CFR Appendix A to Subpart A of Part 1, Section 3(b), your fees shall be waived where the amount of the fee is $25.00 or less.

A search will be conducted for records responsive to your request. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that a FOIA analyst will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request.

Your request has been assigned FOIA Case No. 2024-REE-05419-F. Please refer to this case number in any future correspondence. If you have any questions regarding the processing of this request, please contact Mr. Nicholas Mantzaris electronically at Nicholas.Mantzaris@usda.gov<mailto:Nicholas.Mantzaris@usda.gov> or USDAFOIA@usda.gov<mailto:USDAFOIA@usda.gov>. For additional information regarding USDA FOIA regulations and process, please refer to the information available on-line at Freedom of Information Act Division | USDA<https://www.usda.gov/ogc/office-information-affairs/foia-division>.

We appreciate the opportunity to assist you.

Sincerely,

Office of Information Affairs

Freedom of Information Act Division

[cid:image001.png@01DABE63.025B0450]
Nicholas Mantzaris
FOIA Analyst - Contractor
Freedom of Information Act Division
Office of Information Affairs
U.S. Department of Agriculture
1400 Independence Ave., SW, Room 4049D
Washington, DC 20250
(202) 690-5228
✉     Nicholas.Mantzaris@USDA.gov<mailto:Nicholas.Mantzaris@USDA.gov>






This electronic message contains information generated by the USDA solely for the intended recipients. Any unauthorized interception of this message or the use or disclosure of the information it contains may violate the law and subject the violator to civil or criminal penalties. If you believe you have received this message in error, please notify the sender and delete the email immediately.

title: ARPA Grant Distributions for LifeBridge in Salem, MA

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: ARPA Grant Distributions for LifeBridge in Salem, MA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The distribution and allocation of resources and ARPA grant funds for the LifeBridge transition center.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robby Emslie

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: ARPA Grant Distributions for LifeBridge in Salem, MA
communications.communication:
Robby:

The City of Salem has received your public records request and will ask the appropriate staff members to gather the information requested or provide you with the online links where you can access copies of the records you are seeking.  We will get back to you shortly, within ten (10) business days, as required by law, with a response and/or supply an estimate of fees associated with this request.

Please be aware that the City of Salem has recently made a large number of records available to the public online and you may be able to find the records you are requesting at https://records.salem.com/WebLink/.

Thank you.


Joanne M. Roomey, Paralegal
Records Access Officer
City of Salem Legal Department
93 Washington Street
Salem, MA  01970
978-619-5638 or extension 41503
Jroomey@salem.com<mailto:Jroomey@salem.com>
